citation.article-title: Reclassification of the polyphyletic genus Prosthecomicrobium to form two novel genera, Vasilyevaea gen. nov. and Bauldia gen. nov. with four new combinations: Vasilyevaea enhydra comb. nov., Vasilyevaea mishustinii comb. nov., Bauldia consociata comb. nov. and Bauldia litoralis comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Vasilyevaea enhydra comb. nov.
Vasilyevaea enhydra (en.hy′dra N.L. adj. enhydra living in water, aquatic).
Characteristics are as described by Staley (1968) and Oertli et al. (2006).
In addition, this species contains phosphatidylglycerol and bisphosphatidylglycerol (Sittig & Schlesner, 1993).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 65.8 mol% (buoyant density).
The type strain is strain 9bT (=ATCC 23634T =VKM B-1376T).
